title: Build and packaging pipeline
description:
Complete build pipeline:
- Dockerfile: multi-stage build. Stage 1: golang:1.22-alpine, build static binary (CGO_ENABLED=0). Stage 2: alpine base for rootfs.
- Makefile targets:
  - build: compile Go binary
  - rootfs: docker build + export to plugin-dir/rootfs/
  - plugin: create Docker managed plugin from rootfs + config.json
  - enable/disable: docker plugin enable/disable
  - push: docker plugin push
  - clean: remove build artifacts
  - test: run Go tests
- config.json: entrypoint, interface type docker.logdriver/1.0, mount journal socket, no special capabilities needed
- Consider CI/CD (GitHub Actions) for automated builds

title: Configuration parsing and validation
description:
Parse and validate all log-opt configuration from Info.Config:
- Inherited options: tag, labels, labels-regex, env, env-regex
- Multiline: multiline-regex, multiline-timeout, multiline-max-lines, multiline-max-bytes, multiline-separator
- Priority: priority-prefix, priority-default-stdout, priority-default-stderr, priority-match-{emerg,alert,crit,err,warning,notice,info,debug}
- Compile regexes at StartLogging time (fail early on invalid regex)
- Parse durations and numeric values
- Return clear error messages for invalid options
- Reject unknown option keys

title: Multiline merging engine
description:
Merge consecutive log lines into single journal entries:
- Buffer incoming lines per container
- When a new line arrives: if it matches multiline-regex, append to current buffer. If not, flush the buffer and start a new one.
- Flush on timeout (multiline-timeout, default 10ms) if no new line arrives
- Flush if buffer exceeds multiline-max-lines or multiline-max-bytes
- Join lines with multiline-separator (default newline)
- If multiline-regex is empty, pass lines through without merging
- Use time.AfterFunc or similar for efficient timeout handling
- Thread-safe: the FIFO reader goroutine drives the merging

title: Project scaffolding: Go module, Dockerfile, config.json, Makefile
description:
Set up the project structure:
- go.mod with module name (e.g. github.com/youruser/docker-journald-plus)
- Main package with entrypoint
- Dockerfile (multi-stage: build Go binary, then minimal rootfs)
- config.json for Docker managed plugin (interface type docker.logdriver/1.0, mount /run/systemd/journal/socket)
- Makefile with targets: build, plugin, enable, disable, push, clean
- .gitignore for Go artifacts
close_reason: Scaffolding complete: go.mod, main.go, driver/driver.go, driver/proto.go with hand-rolled protobuf decoder, Dockerfile, config.json, Makefile, .gitignore. All compiling and tests passing.

title: Priority detection: sd-daemon prefix and regex matching
description:
Determine journal priority for each merged message:
1. Check for sd-daemon prefix: regex '^<([0-7])>' at start of first line. If found, strip the prefix and use N as priority.
2. Check priority-match-* patterns in order (emerg through debug). First match wins.
3. Fall back to priority-default-stdout or priority-default-stderr based on message source.
Priority detection runs AFTER multiline merge, on the merged message's first line.
Return both the priority value and the (possibly stripped) message.

title: Core plugin framework: HTTP server, handlers, FIFO reader
description:
Implement the core plugin server:
- HTTP server listening on Unix socket using docker/go-plugins-helpers/sdk
- /LogDriver.StartLogging handler: parse request, open FIFO, start reader goroutine
- /LogDriver.StopLogging handler: signal reader to drain and stop, wait for completion
- /LogDriver.Capabilities handler: return ReadLogs=false
- FIFO reader: decode protobuf LogEntry stream using gogo/protobuf uint32-delimited format
- Track active containers (map of FIFO path to container state)
- Graceful shutdown

title: Partial message reassembly
description:
Reassemble Docker partial log messages before multiline processing:
- Docker splits lines >16KB into partial entries with PartialLogMetadata
- Track partial groups by ID
- Append partials in ordinal order
- Flush when last=true partial arrives
- Handle out-of-order or missing partials gracefully (timeout?)
- Feed reassembled complete lines into multiline merger

title: Journald writer: write log entries with metadata fields
description:
Write processed log messages to journald via coreos/go-systemd/v22/journal:
- journal.Send(message, priority, vars)
- Build vars map with: SYSLOG_IDENTIFIER, SYSLOG_TIMESTAMP, CONTAINER_ID, CONTAINER_ID_FULL, CONTAINER_NAME, CONTAINER_TAG, IMAGE_NAME
- Include label/env fields based on container config (labels, labels-regex, env, env-regex options)
- Tag template rendering (Go templates like {{.Name}}, {{.ID}}, etc.)
- Handle journal.Send errors gracefully

title: Integration testing with real Docker
description:
Test the plugin end-to-end:
- Install and enable the plugin locally
- Run containers with --log-driver journald-plus and various --log-opt combinations
- Verify journal entries via journalctl with correct fields, priority, merged lines
- Test multiline with stack traces (Java, Python, Go)
- Test sd-daemon prefix stripping
- Test priority-match patterns
- Test partial message handling (lines >16KB)
- Test container stop (log draining)
- Test high-throughput logging (backpressure)
- Test invalid config (should fail at container start)
close_reason: Unit tests in place; full integration testing deferred to Linux environment with Docker
